record.title: EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS
record.narrative:
EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS -- (Senate - January 29, 2008)

[Page: S419]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the period for morning business be extended for 2 hours, with the time equally divided.

record.chair: Hearing none, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that any quorum time be equally divided.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I understand we are in a period of morning business.

record.chair: Yes, we are, for roughly 2 hours.
